name: inconceivably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is impossible to imagine or think of: She was almost inconceivably nervous. And if there is a major storm along that coastline, damage will be inconceivably high.
in a way that is extremely unlikely: Inconceivably, he plans to spend two hours a day at the gym. He plays a failed actor whose best friend is, inconceivably, even less successful. See
inconceivable
More examplesFewer examplesThe human brain is almost inconceivably complicated.The man was an aristocrat, inconceivably wealthy.Gravitational waves are created, theoretically, by inconceivably massive objects moving through space at astonishing speeds. Inconceivably, my husband won the half-marathon.
